chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett L. Stratton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 08-11-2015:  Corrected term of probation to 2 yrs.

miscConds.notes: All unpaid Court ordered financial obligations shall convert to civil judgment upon revocation or discharge from probation and Probation Agent shall advise the court of amounts due and owing prior to revocation or discharge.

All unpaid Court ordered financial obligations shall convert to civil judgment upon revocation or discharge from probation and Probation Agent shall advise the court of amounts due and owing prior to revocation or discharge.

Defendant shall submit to and comply with any evaluation, assessment, counselling and/or treatment, as deemed appropriate by Probation Agent and shall pay all applicable costs of same. To include AODA treatment.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants or, unless modified by Probation Agent, shall not enter upon the premises of any business serving intoxicating beverages except as necessary for employment purposes.
Defendant shall have no contact with Cory Peters, Summer Murray, Taylor Pieper, Ronadl Kirsch, Gene Fox, Jaquette Jenskins, Angela Veit or A-F High School, except as allowed by Agent.
